title: Skins & Cosmetics
description: How well do you know Fortnite's iconic skins and cosmetics?

questions.question: What was the final reward skin for Season 2's Battle Pass?
questions.explanation: The Black Knight was the tier 70 reward in Season 2 and remains one of the rarest and most coveted OG skins!

questions.question: Peely is a banana skin in Fortnite.
questions.explanation: Peely is one of Fortnite's most beloved skins - a cheerful banana that has had many variants over the years!

questions.question: Which skin is commonly known as the 'sweat' skin due to its slim design?
questions.explanation: Aura is infamous in the community as a 'sweat' skin, often used by highly skilled players!

questions.question: What is the name of the default dance emote?
questions.explanation: Dance Moves is the iconic free emote that every player starts with - it's become a symbol of Fortnite culture!

questions.question: Skull Trooper was one of the original Halloween skins.
questions.explanation: Skull Trooper debuted during Fortnitemares 2017 and became extremely rare, making it a status symbol among players!

questions.question: Which tier 100 skin from Season 4 could be upgraded with lights?
questions.explanation: Omega was the Season 4 tier 100 skin that could unlock different colored lights by reaching level 80!

questions.question: What type of cosmetic is the 'Take the L' emote?
questions.explanation: Take the L was a Season 3 Battle Pass emote - one of the most iconic and tilting emotes in the game!

questions.question: Renegade Raider is considered one of the rarest skins in Fortnite.
questions.explanation: Renegade Raider was only available in Season 1's item shop and has never returned, making it extremely rare!
